origination.corpname: Michigan Association for Health, Physical Education, Recreation, and Dance.

did.unittitle: Michigan Association for Health, Physical Education, Recreation, and Dance records, 1946-2005
did.abstract: State organization founded in 1927 to promote physical education in schools and tring of Physical education teachers. Records consist of files and photographs relating to the administration and activities of the organization.

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

did.physloc: Portions located in offsite storage; prior notification required for access.

acqinfo.p: The records of the organization were donated in a series of accessions beginning in 1982 (Donor No. 6860).

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open to research.

userestrict.p: Copyright is held by the Regents of the University of Michigan.

prefercite.p: [item], folder, box, Michigan Association for Health, Physical Education, Recreation, and Dance records, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: Interest in physical education in Michigan schools has a long history extending back to the mid-nineteenth century. But it was not until 1911 that the Michigan State Legislature made the teaching of "physical culture" mandatory in city schools and colleges. In 1927, the Michigan Association of Health and Physical Education (which became MAHPER at some unspecified point in time, and Michigan Association of Health, Physical Education, Recreation, and Dance in 1981) formed. It affiliated with the American Physical Education Association in 1930. By the late 1950s, a number of standing committees and regional representatives were established in order to better cope with an expanding membership and shifting professional interests. At this time, the first state conventions and professional workshops and clinics were initiated. The MAHPER Newsletter had been published since 1946; this became the MAHPER News in 1960, and expanded into the larger MAHPER Journal ten years later. In 1981, this became the MAHPERD Journal.

The aims of MAHPERD are to work with state and school officials to promote programs of physical fitness, and to train teachers of physical education. It also functions to advance the profession of physical training and as a clearinghouse for information on personnel and the status of physical education in the schools.

MAHPERD is affiliated with the national American Alliance for Health, Physical Education and Recreation, and is an associate member of the Michigan Educational Association. MAHPERD is organized into seven "divisions": Dance, Girls' and Women's Sports, Health, Men's Athletics, Physical Education, Recreation, and Students. The state is divided into six districts. Each division has its own vice-president, and each district has a president. Officers in the state organization include a past-president, a president, a president-elect, a secretary-treasurer, an editor, a membership secretary, an executive secretary and seven representatives to special organizations. Official business is the responsibility of the Board of Directors and a Representative Assembly.

scopecontent.p: The MAHPERD records consist of files and photographs relating to the administration and activities of the organization as it sought to promote the expansion of physical education and recreational activities in schools and communities across Michigan. The records were received in several accessions beginning in 1982 (boxes 1-7); 1988-1889 (box 8) and 1992 (boxes 8-9). The physical arrangement of the records reflects the accessions. There is some overlap and continuation of content between the accessions. The records have been arranged in the following series: History; Associated Organizations; Awards; Committees; Conferences and Workshops; Conventions; Correspondence; Finances; Girls and Women's Athletics; Meetings (includes Board of Directors and Executive Board); Publicity; Organization; Petitions and Position Papers; Projects and Special Interests; Publications; Reports, Scrapbooks and Miscellanea; Photographs; Presidents Files; Yearly Files; and Executive Director Files.

Researchers concerned with school curricula might use these papers to examine the conflicts and congruencies between physical training and specifically academic disciplines. Furthermore, there is ample material on women's athletics. From its inception, MAHPER seems to have had more egalitarian relations between the sexes than is the case in many professional associations; of the MAHPER presidents holding office between 1926 and 1962, nearly half were women. MAHPER has long been opposed to the second-rate physical education given to girls and young women. In sum, the primary interest of this collection is its documentation of shifting attitudes towards physical education both on the part of the general public and among professionals.

scopecontent.p: The series History consists of a brief history of MAHPER compiled in 1962 by the organization itself, a map delineating the six MAHPER districts, and an informational brochure on the purposes of the Association.

Associated Organizations contains material on the relationship between MAHPER and a number of Michigan groups. These include the Council of State Organizations (COSO), the Michigan Educational Association (MEA), the Michigan Educational Research Council (MERC), and the Michigan High School Athletic Association. Other additional associated organizations may be found in the series Girls' and Women's Athletics.

did.unittitle: Competency-Based Teacher Evaluation, Ad Hoc Committee for
Executive Secretary, Ad Hoc Committee to Evaluate the Role of 1976
Image Improvement, Ad Hoc Committee for
Physical Education and Health Education, Ad Hoc Committee on Clarification of the Relationship between 1968-1970 Physical Education Committee, 1954-1956
Restructure of MAHPER, Ad Hoc Committee for 1975-1978

scopecontent.p: The Conferences and Workshops series includes both the programs and planning materials for the various conferences sponsored by the association.

Conventions is a fairly substantial set of files. It begins in the 1950s and ends in 1981, but the most extensive coverage is from the years 1969-1975. For these years, there is correspondence relating to the convention, material from the planning committees, financial considerations, and convention programs. There are two chronological runs of convention files, received in different accessions.
Correspondence spans the years 1960-1981. It is followed by Finances, which is further divided into Audits, Budgets, Ledgers, Reports, information on Tax Exempt Status for MAHPER, and miscellanea.

Girls' and Women's Athletics is one of the most substantial sections of the collection. The largest subdivision within it is the MAHPER Division of Girls' and Women's Sports. Here there are folders for Conferences and Workshops, Correspondence, Finances, Intercollegiate Competition, Minutes, Newsletters, Officiating, the Organization of the Division itself (its Constitution, Officers, Operating Codes, Policies and Structural Charts), Papers, Reports, Resolutions, and Miscellanea. Additional associated organizations to be found in this subdivision are the Michigan Board of the National Section on Women's Athletics, (an early organization, 1939-1953), the Michigan Girls' Athletic Association, and the Representative Council for Michigan Women's Intercollegiate Sports.

did.unittitle: Division of Girls' and Women's Sports
Michigan Board of the National Section on Women's Athletics 1939-1953
Michigan Girls Athletic Association 1972-1974 Representative Council for Michigan Women's Intercollegiate Sports, 1959-1970

scopecontent.p: Meetings is organized into annual meetings, annual Business Meetings, Board of Directors, Executive Board, General Board, and governing Board Meetings and Representative Assemblies. The latter includes not only minutes and reports, but also material concerning the planning of the Assemblies. Here one segment of material from the Midwest District of the AAHPER is included, since that Assembly was held in Michigan (1970).

did.unittitle: Midwest District of the American Association for Health, Physical Education and Recreation

scopecontent.p: The Organization series is the largest in the collection. Organization is further subdivided into Constitutions (1947-1972), Districts, Divisions (the Division of Girls' and Women's Sports should be considered along with this category), officers, Operating Codes, and Regions.

The Projects and Special Interest series includes files on a number of MAHPERD's activities. Among the most notable is Michigan Exemplary Physical Education Programs Project Steering Committee (.5 linear foot), consisting of meeting minutes, memoranda, rosters, position statements, schedules, reports, evaluative instructional activities, games, lesson plans, and procedural guidelines. This file contains records which closely follow the implementation of k-12 physical education initiatives in Michigan. The file is arranged by year, 1986-1991. Of particular interest are the records generated in 1988, primarily documenting collaborative efforts between MEPEPP and Michigan Department of Education. Included in this series are goals and objectives, evaluative criteria, and instructional models.

Midwest District of the American Alliance for Health, Physical Education, Recreation, and Dance, contains one folder of records documenting the activities of this regional parent organization between 1980 and 1983. In addition, this series contains records documenting the work of state chapters other than Michigan.

did.unittitle: Michigan Exemplary Physical Education Programs Project Steering Committee 1986-1988
Michigan Exemplary Physical Education Programs Project 1989-1991
Midwest District of the American Alliance for Health, Physical Education, Recreation, and Dance 1980-1983

scopecontent.p: Publications consists of Correspondence, Editors' Reports, and an almost complete run of MAHPER official publications, from the MAHPER News (1960-1969) and the later MAHPER Journal (1970-1982). There are even a few of the early MAHPER Newsletters, from 1946-1959. The convention programs document the official tasks, studies, and activities of top priority for each particular year. The journals provide overviews of the development of MAHPERD goals and objectives. Additional MAHPERD publications consisting of special reports on activity planning and performance objectives, evaluative criteria, and educational guidelines, are included in the file "MAHPER. 1960-1979." Michigan Department of Education materials include education manuals, program standards, survey reports, and curricula models. MEPEPP materials include project overviews, survey and evaluation guidelines, and developmental handbooks and guides. The Midwest District AAHPERD materials consist of convention programs. The "Miscellaneous" file contains newsletters, special reports and journals created by outside agencies related to MAHPERD.
Reports that did not fit into other headings are located next, along with a Scrapbook of clippings and MAHPER announcements from 1955, and one folder of Miscellanea.

did.unittitle: Michigan Department of Education: Physical Education Interpretive Reports 1981-1982, 1984-1985

scopecontent.p: The Photos series consists of five folder of prints of convention speakers and various officers. Photos in box 11 include four prints of MAHPERD officials. There are two pictures of Dr. Hal Ray, MAHPERD president 1986-1987, and pictures of two professors of health and physical education, Dr. Margaret S. Large, and Dr. Janet Wessel.

Presidents' Files (.75 linear foot) 1967-1989. The files have been arranged alphabetically. These topical files provide information about all aspects of the organization, (i.e. committees, districts, workshops, bylaws, etc.) and concentrate on the activities that took place during the years 1971-1974. Of special note is the correspondence file of Betty Menzi, who was a president of MAHPER in the early 1970s.

did.unittitle: Delegates to be sent to Representative Assembly 1972-1974
Division of Girls and Women's Sports (DGWS) 1972-1974
Task Force on Competency-Based Teacher Education 1974

scopecontent.p: Yearly Files, which comprises 1.25 linear feet of the collection, consists of memoranda, correspondence, meeting minutes, agendas, schedules, rosters, progress reports, budget proposals, financial reports, and service and project descriptions. The majority of the records are created by the administrative officers and the MAHPERD departmental representatives. There are also documents created by agencies outside MAHPERD, including AAHPERD, Michigan Department of Education, Michigan Recreation and Park Association, American Heart Association, National Association for Sport and Physical Recreation, and regional universities. The materials in this series document the perpetual process of improving the health of the community through improving physical education instruction and evaluation.
